news_header: Moldovan President Maia Sandu claimed victory in the election runoff, facing off against pro-Russian candidate Alexandr Stoianoglo. The election results could impact Moldova's European future amidst concerns of foreign interference.
news_text: Maia Sandu, the incumbent President of Moldova, declared victory in the election runoff against former prosecutor general Alexandr Stoianoglo, who was supported by the pro-Russian Socialist Party. With nearly 99% of votes counted, Sandu received 54.7% while Stoianoglo garnered 45.3%. Sandu emphasized the importance of the election for Moldova's European future and alleged foreign meddling in the process. She previously received 42.5% in the first round, while Stoianoglo had 26%. Despite a narrow referendum result favoring EU membership, Sandu remains committed to a pro-European agenda, while Stoianoglo has been accused of being a Kremlin ally.
